title: Bootstrap Introduction
description: Bootstrap is a free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development. It contains CSS- and JavaScript-based design templates for typography, forms, buttons, navigation and other interface components.

title: Bootstrap Grid System
description:
Bootstrap's grid system uses a series of containers, rows, and columns to layout and align content. It's built with flexbox and is fully responsive.

The grid system is responsive, and the columns will re-arrange depending on the screen size.

title: Bootstrap Components
description:
Bootstrap includes dozens of reusable components built to provide navigation, alerts, popovers, and much more. These components are built with the Base CSS and are extended with jQuery plugins.

Components include buttons, cards, modals, carousels, and many more interactive elements.

title: Bootstrap Utilities
description:
Bootstrap includes dozens of utility classes for showing, hiding, aligning, spacing, and more. These utility classes are for rapid prototyping and building custom components.

Utility classes can be used to modify the appearance and behavior of elements without writing custom CSS.

title: Bootstrap Customization
description:
Bootstrap can be customized to fit your brand or design needs. You can customize Bootstrap's Sass variables, override built-in styles, or create your own themes.

Customizing Bootstrap allows you to create unique designs while still leveraging Bootstrap's powerful framework.
